definition: to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract

sentences.english: Most people never get tired of delivering a festival similar to the activities of the sweepstakes .
sentences.chinese: 人們最樂此不疲的一項節日活動類似於摸彩。

sentences.english: One of the most popular events of the day was a game like drawing lottery.
sentences.chinese: 人們最樂此不疲的一項節日活動類似於摸彩。

sentences.english: Some places have already quit lotteries.
sentences.chinese: 一些地方已經停止摸彩了。

sentences.english: Seems like we got through with the last one only last week.
sentences.chinese: 上次摸彩就好象還是上個星期的事兒呢。

sentences.english: Used to be a saying about 'Lottery in June, corn be heavy soon.
sentences.chinese: 有句老話說‘六月裏摸彩，玉米熟得快。’

sentences.english: There's always been a lottery , " he added petulantly."
sentences.chinese: 摸彩是永遠要有，”他生氣地加上說。

sentences.english: Event program book advertising space available; raffle prize donations welcome.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎各廠商購登年刊廣告和捐贈摸彩獎品。

sentences.english: On Sundays, we played tombola there over lunch.
sentences.chinese: 到了週日，我們會在午餐時玩摸彩遊戲。

sentences.english: The draw's first prize is a new BMW.
sentences.chinese: 這次摸彩的頭等獎是一輛新的寶馬汽車。

sentences.english: Thought we were going to have to get on without you, Tessie .
sentences.chinese: 還以爲我們接下去摸彩要不帶你了呢，泰西。

sentences.english: The child was delighted with the bauble she had won in the grab bag.
sentences.chinese: 這孩子非常喜歡摸彩袋贏得的那個小玩意兒。

sentences.english: Now you dip in the bran-tub and see what you get.
sentences.chinese: 喂，摸彩碰碰運氣吧，看你會得到什麼。

definition: toy in a capsule (dispensed from a vending machine)
to announce the winners in a lottery
to go to church on Sunday (of Christians)
(Tw) benefit/advantage/(from Taiwanese 好空, Tai-lo pr. [hó-khang])
